column4: anybody know some tips (or links) for setting up a belkin wireless router in ubuntu? i just get dead ends..
should just work standard, what's the problem?
i happen to have a belkin myself
if ubuntu finds your card there's a icon on the top right of your screen
if its there and u clock it u should see a list of the available networks
its also important u pick the right incription, and if its hex or not, etc
how do u mean hook it up? your wireless card?
i have no experience with USB adapters, its possible ubuntu doesnt detect it (not every card / usb card is suported)
what u could try first is boot your computer with the USB card allready plugged in
u can do that too, wired everything sohuld work out of the box
u could try searching for your usb adapter on the internet, to see if there's a working driver for your model
to search use "modelname ubuntu" or something
can u give me the model, brand, etc of you usb card?
see, wols probably found it trough google :p
